item.title: The beginning of a new era?
item.description: At noon on January 20, Donald J. Trump was sworn in for the second time to serve as President of the United States, the first President to serve two non-consecutive terms since Grover Cleveland in the late 19th century. Whatever my personal feelings, Trump pulled off the biggest political upset in American history. Trump has committed to declaring a national emergency that would allow him to close the border, use American troops to conduct these operations and carry out sweeps in American cities to arrest undocumented foreigners. Trump has pledged to arm the Justice Department and use the agency to prosecute his political enemies, including generals, former and current public office holders, former Presidents and their families, journalists and anyone else he claims to have. “crossed” during his ten-year political career. Making light of the word “hostages”, Trump pardoned or pardoned around 1,500 people who participated in the January 6 riots, including those who attacked police officers and those who were convicted of trying to overthrow the government. Trump promised to remake America, and I believe he will try to do so. We will see whether or not it will be successful in converting a constitutional republic into an authoritarian electoral autocracy. The effects of Trump's seizure of power began to reverberate around the world. Some of his supporters claim that Donald Trump's victory guaranteed a ceasefire in Gaza that allowed the return of 33 Israeli hostages and the release of around 90 Palestinian prisoners. After 15 months, the guns are silent. However, other observers note that the terms of this ceasefire are almost identical to those that the Israeli government rejected last May. They accuse Netanyahu of having rejected these terms to prevent Biden and Harris from a hard-won victory that could help them in the 2024 US elections. Instead, Netanyahu waited until Trump was elected to give him credit for the ceasefire that everyone wanted. If these allegations are true, they illustrate the absolute selfishness and cynicism of Netanyahu and Trump. Since May, thousands of Palestinians and hundreds of Israelis have been killed or injured, along with the destruction of their homes and belongings. And for what? To keep Netanyahu out of prison and to give Trump his electoral victory? Historians will debate this question for decades, just as they debated the Paris Agreement to end the Vietnam War in the fall of 1968; or the negotiations to free the American embassy hostages held by the new Iranian revolutionary government. Although unstable, the ceasefire remains in Gaza and the Middle East. Thousands of kilometers away, to the north, the war is rather in Ukraine and Russia. Trump had promised that he would end this war on the "day one." This achievement did not happen. Quite the contrary. Last week, European leaders said their support for Ukraine and its President Volodymyr Zelensky. French President Emmanuel Macron warned that the war against Ukraine would not end "tomorrow or the day after tomorrow." The third anniversary of the Russian War against Ukraine is celebrated next month. Macron also urged Europe to “wake up” and spend more in defense to reduce his alliance with the US. Macron's reaction is that Trump's inauguration is an "opportunity for a European strategic care call." Macron stated that Europe must fully “play its role” in the rearmament of Ukraine. In a similar speech, Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Great Britain, on his first visit to Kiev, committed to supplying Ukraine with a new air defense system called Gravehawk. Britain and Denmark developed this missile defense to allow the Ukrainians to shoot down aerial threats using retooled ground-launched air-to-air missiles. Norway promised Ukraine six American-made F-16s, while France promised Mirage 2000-5. Ukrainian forces used ground-based drones equipped with machine guns and mines to carry out the first documented all-machine ground attack in their war against Russia. Ukraine claims that Russia suffered 434,000 casualties in 2024 alone and that around 819,000 Russian soldiers have been killed, captured or injured since the start of the war in February 2022. Ukraine has not reported its own casualties, but estimates Westerners point to around 300,000 Ukrainian casualties, along with at least 600,000 Russian casualties. Ukraine declared that last week, in a single day, Russia lost more than 2200 soldiers. However, despite these heavy losses, Russia has used its superiority in terms of population and resources to slowly and progressively conquer the Ukrainian territory. Since a year ago, Russia has been making daily attacks with human waves throughout the 3000 km from the Eastern front. Moscow reported that he had captured several villages and cities in his attempt to capture the once -bustling Pokrovsk city. The capture of the ruined city would open the rest of Donetsk province to Russian capture. Russia has used thousands of North Korean forces in its attempt to resume the areas of Kursk province that Ukraine took last summer. However, these malnourished and poorly trained North Korean troops suffered heavy casualties, and for the first time the Ukrainians have captured and are currently interrogating two North Korean soldiers. Russia has launched a combined attack of drones and missiles against several Ukrainian cities, including one in downtown Kiev. On a visit to Moscow on January 17, Russian President Vladimir Putin and Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian signed a vast cooperation pact that deepens his partnership. Russia's ties with Iran narrowed after Putin sent troops to Ukraine. Ukraine and the West have accused Tehran of providing Moscow hundreds of drones to be used to attack Ukraine. Pezeshkian stated, "We watched a new chapter of strategic relations." Yesterday, Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Putin spoke on the phone about Ukraine, Donald Trump's inauguration and the Middle East. It is not yet known what has been said. Ukraine fears this day since Donald Trump was elected on November 6. Trump blames Ukraine and its president because they caused the circumstances that allowed their first dismissal in 2019. For Trump, the unprecedented request for Zelensky to find "rotten" about the Biden was a "perfect decision." In contrast, Trump has had good personal ties with Russian autocratic president Vladimir Putin, ties reaffirmed at his meeting in Helsinchy during Trump's first term. Trump said several times that he believes that Ukraine was partially responsible for the Russian invasion, due to his will, supported by the West, to join the NATO. Ukraine was only able to keep Russia in a military draw thanks to the influx of western military aid, especially American, and the blood of the Ukrainian people who resisted the invasion. Ukraine fears that Putin and Trump meet alone in any “neutral” European capital and make an agreement, an agreement to give Russia the two Eastern provinces of Donetsk and Lukhansk, Crimea and the Azov Sea Coast. Fears that Ukraine does not receive military security guarantees, such as adherence to the NATO or EU. Finally, fears that Zelensky is forced to fire himself and to be replaced by a pro-Russian Ukrainian politician. If this happens, Ukraine and most Western nations believe that the country will cease to exist within a year, as Russia will absorb the state as Germany absorbed the entire Czechoslovakia six months after the Munich conference. Europe knows that Donald Trump's inauguration means that the responsibility of maintaining the freedom of Ukraine falls on his shoulders and that the United States can no longer be counted to militarily defend Europe from external aggression. Soon, the world will witness whether we are watching the 1945 Peace Agreement, based on an order based on rules, territorial integrity, sovereignty of all nations, and multilateral decisions and actions. Donald Trump's inauguration that the world came into dangerous times, perhaps recalling the ages that preceded the first and World War II.

item.title: Chinese companies have released updates to generative AI models in recent days
item.description:
Several Chinese technology companies such as ByteDance, Moonshot AI and DeepSeek this week presented updates to their generative artificial intelligence (AI) models, highlighting their advances in complex tasks such as mathematics and programming.
Bytedance, known internationally for creating the social network of short videos Tiktok, made known its real -time voice model, called Doubao, designed to act as an English teacher or narrator for users, according to the News Portal YICAI LOCATION. DeepSeek, in turn, presented the DeepSeek-R1 model, which the company assured is comparable to the OpenAI o1 model in tasks such as mathematical problem solving, programming and natural language inference. OpenAI is the creator of the famous ChatGPT that accelerated the development of the generative AI market. MoonShot Ai presented, however, the Kimi K1.5 model, which is able to offer similar performance to OpenAi O1 in Multimodal Mathematics, programming and reasoning. The Chinese Tencent also presented the open source Hunyuan3D 2.0 model, designed to convert 2D images into 3D images, with applications planned for the development of video games, advertising in e-commerce and industrial production. In total, more than 200 large-scale language models (LLM – Large Language Model) were launched on the Chinese market. Among the registered models are some developed by Chinese technological giants such as Jiutian, China Mobile, Baidu Wenxin Yiyan, Tongyin Qianwen, Alibaba, Pangu, Huawei Cloud, Andpo, and Lanxin, Vivo. In July 2023, China approved interim regulations to regulate generative artificial intelligence services similar to ChatGPT, which will be subject to “current regulations on information security, personal data protection, intellectual property, and scientific and technological progress.” In addition, they must respect the “fundamental socialist values”, “social morality and professional ethics” and are prohibited from “generating content that undermines national security, territorial unity, social stability or the rights and legitimate interests of others people". Given this, questions arose about the application of this type of technology in China due to the strong censorship imposed by the authorities. Lusa
